headline: NATO Just Funded A British Startup That Says Its AI Tech Can Spot Deadly Bio Threats Before They Spread—Even The Ones We Didn't Know Existed
summary: The NATO Innovation Fund has co-led a $35 million Series A round into Portal Biotech, a U.K.-based life sciences startup that claims it has developed the world's first platform for full-length, single-molecule protein sequencing. This marks the fund's first investment in a biotechnology firm and signals a strategic move to boost global defense against future biological threats, Reuters says. Portal Biotech was founded in 2021 by Andy Heron and Giovanni Maglia, according to the company's website.

Portal Biotech was founded in 2021 by Andy Heron and Giovanni Maglia, according to the company's website.

headline: Bill Gates Says Elon Musk Was 'Super Mean' After He Shorted Tesla Stock — 'But He's Super Mean to So Many People'
summary: It started with a stock short and ended with memes, jabs, and one of the messiest billionaire feuds in recent memory. Bill Gates isn't new to criticism, but he didn't expect a full-on cold war with Elon Musk. At least, not over Tesla. "Once he heard I'd shorted the stock, he was super mean to me," Gates told Walter Isaacson, the author of Musk's 2023 biography. Then came the part that made the quote instantly viral: "But he's super mean to so many people, so you can't take it too personally." Ga

headline: Waymo expands coverage in Austin, Texas, as robotaxi competition heats up
summary: Waymo, which has over 100 vehicles on the Uber platform in Austin, will now cover new neighborhoods such as Crestview, Windsor Park, Sunset Valley and Franklin Park, the company said.  After cautiously expanding its self-driving taxi services across the U.S. for years, Waymo is now largely seen as the frontrunner in the space.

headline: Uber & Lucid, Union Pacific, Sarepta: Trending Tickers
summary: Uber (UBER) is teaming up with Lucid (LCID) and self-driving start-up Nuro (NURO.PVT) amid a push into robotaxis. Union Pacific (UNP) is reportedly considering an acquisition of a competitor like CSX (CSX) or Norfolk Southern (NSC), according to reporting from Semafor. Sarepta Therapeutics (SRPT) is cutting a third of its staff, saving $400 million in annual costs, as part of its restructuring efforts. The stock spikes higher on news of the job cuts. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts here.

headline: An 18-Year-Old Asks Reddit For Financial Advice: 'I'd Like To Get Into Investing'
summary: Eighteen-year-olds are in one of the best spots to make long-term investments. They don't have as many financial responsibilities as parents and can wait several years before they even have to think about selling some of their stocks. However, being young also gives them less experience. That's why an 18-year-old who's interested in investing turned to Reddit for some suggestions. headline: Uber to invest $300 million in EV maker Lucid as part of robotaxi deal
summary: SAN FRANCISCO (Reuters) -Uber will invest $300 million in electric vehicle maker Lucid in a robotaxi deal that aims to start with one major U.S. city late next year, the companies said on Thursday.  Over six years starting in 2026, Uber will acquire and deploy over 20,000 Lucid Gravity SUVs that will be equipped with autonomous vehicle (AV) technology from startup Nuro, the three companies said in a statement.  The agreement illustrates the renewed plans and push for financing for self-driving cabs years after a first wave of autonomous driving investment produced only a limited number of vehicles.

raw.headline: Uber to invest $300 million in EV maker Lucid as part of robotaxi deal

Over six years starting in 2026, Uber will acquire and deploy over 20,000 Lucid Gravity SUVs that will be equipped with autonomous vehicle (AV) technology from startup Nuro, the three companies said in a statement.  The agreement illustrates the renewed plans and push for financing for self-driving cabs years after a first wave of autonomous driving investment produced only a limited number of vehicles.

headline: Lucid, Nuro, and Uber Partner on Next-Generation Autonomous Robotaxi Program
summary: SAN FRANCISCO & MOUNTAIN VIEW, Calif. & NEWARK, Calif., July 17, 2025--Lucid Group, Inc. (NASDAQ: LCID), Nuro, Inc. ("Nuro"), and Uber Technologies, Inc. (NYSE: UBER) ("Uber") today announced a next-generation premium global robotaxi program created exclusively for the Uber ride-hailing platform.
